page.title: 05Wentworth Woodhouse
page.content: {Wentworth Woodhouse}has the longest house front in Britain. It is in the Guinness Book of Records.The{East {front}of the house is{606ft long.}It is called Woodhouse because the first house built there was probably made of wood. The present house is built out of Sandstone. At Wentworth there are really two houses back to back. The {West Front}was completed in{1734}then work started on the much larger{East {Front.}The architect was{Henry {Flitcroft}and the work took many years to finish. The house was built in the {Palladian}style. Inside the house the rooms are very richly decorated. The {Whistlejacket Room}is named after a {racehorse}owned by the{2nd. Marquess. There used to be a painting of the horse in the room.{Sheffield City {Polytechnic}now use Wentworth House for teacher training.
